summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 10, 2019, reporting a failure of the NICEVision camera system on August 8, 2019, which prevented the recovery of video footage from the housing unit. The document is significant as it details a technical failure of surveillance equipment at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

persons.name: SIS Lieutenant
persons.context: The SIS Lieutenant authored the memorandum reporting the failure of the NICE camera system at the MCC New York facility.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The Captain is the intended recipient of the memorandum regarding the camera system failure.

persons.name: Communication Technician
persons.role: Technician responding to the camera system failure
persons.context: The Communication Technician was called via radio to address the NICE camera system failure and stated it would be fixed on August 9, 2019.

events.title: NICE Camera System Failure at MCC New York
events.description: On August 8, 2019, at approximately 3:45 PM, the SIS Lieutenant discovered that the NICE camera system at the MCC New York facility was not recording and no previous video footage from the 5-South Housing Unit could be recovered. A Communication Technician confirmed the issue and stated it would be fixed the following day.

events.title: Scheduled Repair of Camera System
events.description: The Communication Technician stated the camera system would be fixed on Friday, August 9, 2019, when he arrived to work.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The NICE camera surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York failed on August 8, 2019, preventing the recovery of any video footage.
The failure was discovered during a review of footage from the 5-South Housing Unit, which is significant as this was the unit where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
A Communication Technician confirmed the system was not recording and there was no way to retrieve any video, indicating a complete system outage.
The memorandum was written on August 10, 2019, documenting a critical security system failure just days before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
